DOC.detailed_description: To evaluate need drug counseling aim reduce illicit drug use increase buprenorphine/naloxone adherence , propose study compare manual-guided Physician Management ( PM ) PM combine on-site manual-guided Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) 24 week randomize clinical trial buprenorphine/naloxone heterogeneous population opioid dependent patient ( N=140 ) primary care clinic . PM , consistent federal regulation , design reflect usual care primary care physician include referral ancillary service . CBT provide skilled psychologist weekly session first 12 week focus reduce illicit drug use increase buprenorphine/naloxone adherence . The study test hypothesis addition CBT PM lead decrease illicit drug use , durable effect counsel discontinue , improve buprenorphine/naloxone adherence demonstrate incremental cost-effectiveness patient receive buprenorphine/naloxone maintenance primary care . Primary outcome measure include reduction illicit opioid use abstinence achievement , assess weekly urine toxicology test self report . Secondary outcome measure include retention treatment , reduction cocaine use HIV risk , decrease criminal activity improve health employment status . Utilization cost service , spillover effect PCC , patient staff perception benefit problem associate primary care agonist maintenance treatment also evaluate . The result study help define role professional evidence-based drug counsel expand access treatment buprenorphine/naloxone .
